column2: WASHINGTON DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Washington
column6: WA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: Blue indicates road user services.
column6: They give directional information.
column8: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.
column10: Blue indicates pedestrian crossings and school zones.

column2: 2. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the right curb or edge of the road.
column6: near the left edge of the road.
column8: on the left shoulder of the road.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column6: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column8: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.

column2: 4. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.
column6: cut abruptly in front of it.
column8: pay close attention to the turn signals.

column2: 5. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column4: obey signals from crossing guards.
column6: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.
column8: stop if necessary.

column2: 6. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: Pedestrians may turn right.
column6: Drivers should walk more and drive less.
column8: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.
column10: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Narrow Bridge
column6: No right turn
column8: No left turn

column2: 8. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: wear approved helmets.
column6: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column8: signal turns, lane changes and stops.

column2: 9. BAC is:
column4: the acronym for Beer ACcumulation.
column6: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the amount of alcohol in your body.
column10: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 10. When the road is slippery, you should:
column4: use your emergency or parking brake.
column6: brake suddenly carefully.
column8: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.

column2: 11. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column6: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column8: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.

column2: 12. This sign means:
column4: Sharp right turn ahead.
column6: Right turns not allowed.
column8: Hairpin corner ahead.

column2: 13. If you are involved in a collision with a parked vehicle, you need to:
column4: call a tow truck at your expenses.
column6: try to find the owner, or leave a note with the time and date telling the owner how to reach you.
column8: call the police.
column10: stay at the scene until the owner of the parked vehicle returns.

column2: 14. This sign indicates that:
column4: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column6: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column8: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.
column10: there is a school zone after the curve.

column2: 15. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column6: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.
column8: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column10: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.

column2: 16. Alcohol:
column4: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.
column6: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column8: enhances your ability to see clearly.

column2: 17. This sign indicates:
column4: Winding road
column6: Merging traffic
column8: Double curve ahead

column2: 18. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: look for a human flagger.
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column8: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column10: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.

column2: 19. At an uncontrolled intersection, drivers must:
column4: speed up and clear the intersection as soon as possible.
column6: take the right of way.
column8: wait for other vehicles to give them the right of way.
column10: slow down, yield to any vehicle already in the intersection and to the vehicles coming from the right.

column2: 20. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column6: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column8: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 21. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column6: wait for the next green light.
column8: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
column10: enter the intersection and then stop.

column2: 22. This sign indicates:
column4: A no-passing zone
column6: A slow-moving vehicle
column8: Yield

column2: 23. Any time a driver wants to merge with other traffic, they should:
column4: always wait until their lane is ending and then merge.
column6: merge only when other drivers have stopped their vehicles.
column8: allow a space cushion of about 4 seconds.
column10: merge as fast as they can.

column2: 24. If you stop along the road at night:
column4: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.
column6: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.
column8: turn on your headlights only.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: Merge, then slow down to the safe speed indicated
column6: The road ahead curves right; slow down to indicated speed
column8: Divided highway begins. Slow down to the safe speed indicated
column10: Winding road ahead; slow down to the indicated speed

column2: 26. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column4: 30 minutes.
column6: one hour.
column8: 3 hours.

column2: 27. If one of your tires blows out while driving, you should:
column4: apply the brakes firmly and steer toward the right edge of the road.
column6: hold the steering wheel firmly, slow down, and steer smoothly.
column8: hold the steering wheel tightly and shift into neutral to bring the front of the vehicle back in line.

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column4: A left turn can be made only after stopping
column6: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection
column8: Right turn is not permitted

column2: 29. This road sign means:
column4: You must turn right
column6: No U-turns
column8: No right turn

column2: 30. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column6: The bus is about to stop.
column8: You must pass the school bus.
column10: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn
column6: Do not pass
column8: No U-turns

column2: 32. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.
column6: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.
column8: Drivers who have overslept.

column2: 33. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column6: go faster.
column8: slow down.

column2: 34. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column6: Rounabout ahead.
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column10: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

column2: 35. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
column4: an advance warning sign.
column6: a crossbuck sign.
column8: a speed limit sign.

column2: 36. This sign warns that:
column4: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.
column6: traffic must merge right.
column8: the pavement ends.

column2: 37. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Brake lightly.
column6: Shift to a lower gear.
column8: Use your ABS System.
column10: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 38. When you see a school bus on a road with two lanes traveling in opposite directions, you must stop:
column4: only if you’re going in the same direction as the bus.
column6: if the bus has flashing red warning lights.
column8: if the bus is off the road and the yellow lights are flashing.
column10: if the bus has flashing yellow lights.

column2: 39. Car insurance is important because:
column4: it may be required by law.
column6: it protects your car.
column8: it protects yourself and others.
column10: you can drive faster if you have the proper insurance coverage.

column2: 40. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column6: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column8: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.
column10: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
